text: Kazimierz Ludwik Piłsudski ( 1700 – 1775) He was the great-great-grandfather of Marshal of Poland Józef Piłsudski. Kazimierz Piłsudski of the Piłsudski coat of arms was most likely born at the turn of the 17th and 18th centuries as the only son of Roch Mikołaj Piłsudski and Małgorzata née Pancerzyńska. His mother's brother was Bishop Karol Piotr Pancerzyński. In 1722 he took over the mayorship of Alkis. He was married twice: to Marianna nee Kukiewicz and to Rozalia, a priest. Puzunianka, with whom he had several children (Kazimierz (Józef Piłsudski's great-grandfather) and children whose names are unknown). He owned the estates of Zemelany, Sugawdzie, Brynkiszki, Bugenia, Kiełpiszki, Jutkajcie, Alkiszki and Dyrwiany. He probably died in the second half. 18th century. Category:1700 births Category:1775 deaths Category:Polish people
title: Kazimierz Ludwik Piłsudski
